author: Staff Reporter
text:
JNU Students’ Union leader Kanhaiya Kumar’s much-anticipated visit to Pune next month has drawn support from noted litterateur Shripal Sabnis, who on Wednesday said attempts to ban or proscribe Mr. Kumar’s talk were “utterly unjust.”

“The attempt to stifle his [Kanhaiya’s] freedom of speech by banning and cancelling his talk is not proper... despite charges of sedition against him. It is yet to be proved whether he raised anti-national slogans,” said Dr. Sabnis, who is president of the 89th Akhil Bharatiya Marathi Sahitya Sammelan.

The proposed talk and its venue have already seen battle lines being drawn sharply between student outfits belonging to opposing political ideologies, while throwing educational authorities and the police into a tizzy.

In his statement supporting Mr. Kumar, Dr. Sabnis also said rightwing outfits were attempting to disrupt Kanhaiya’s event in the city.
title: Marathi author backs Kanhaiya
